## ERROR TIPS

### Power system connection issues
- Ensure steam engines are properly connected to both the fluid system (steam pipes) and electrical network
- Verify all pipe connections between offshore pump, boiler and steam engine are properly established
- Check that power poles connect all electrical consumers to the steam engine

### Entity placement collisions
- When placing inserters or other entities near existing structures, ensure there is sufficient space
- Consider increasing spacing parameter or changing direction when placement fails
- Check for nearby entities that might block placement (mining drills, chests, etc.)

### Fluid system troubleshooting
- Verify fluid connections between all components in the chain (pump → boiler → engine)
- Check that pipes are properly aligned and connected to the correct ports
- Ensure there are no gaps or misalignments in the pipe network

### Power verification
- Always verify power status of electrical mining drills after connection
- Check that steam engine shows WORKING status before assuming power is available
- Monitor power production and consumption to ensure sufficient capacity

### Water source placement
- Verify water source exists before attempting to place offshore pump
- Ensure offshore pump is placed directly adjacent to water
- Check terrain type before placing boilers/engines to avoid water tiles

### Component spacing
- Maintain proper spacing between boiler and steam engine (2 tiles minimum)
- Ensure all power plant components are placed on land, not water
- Verify clear path for pipe connections between components
